definition: to destroy/to spoil/to ruin/to injure/cruel/oppressive/savage/brutal/incomplete/disabled/to remain/to survive/remnant/surplus

sentences.english: He was disabled in the civil war; he lost his left arm.
sentences.chinese: 他在內戰中失去一條左臂，成了傷殘人。

sentences.english: Her arm was mutilated in the accident.
sentences.chinese: 她的一隻胳臂在事故中傷殘了。

sentences.english: He has a discompetency pension from the government.
sentences.chinese: 他擁有一筆政府發的傷殘撫卹金。

sentences.english: The new insurance rules speculate that the disabled FOR the public benefit are to receive more money.
sentences.chinese: 新的保險條例規定因公傷殘者將得到更多的撫卹金。

sentences.english: I have seen horrible deaths and mutilations.
sentences.chinese: 我所看到的可怕的死亡和傷殘。

sentences.english: He showed that physical sicknesses and disabilities sometimes were caused by emotional conflicts.
sentences.chinese: 他證明，軀體性疾病或傷殘有時是由情感衝突引起的。

sentences.english: The union also provides otherwise unobtainable access to disability insurance.
sentences.chinese: 工會也提供在特定情況下的傷殘保險。

sentences.english: His broken body does all the talking for him.
sentences.chinese: 他那傷殘的身體爲他訴說了所有的遭遇。

sentences.english: Impairment expertise opportunity of femoral neck fracture caused in traffic accident.
sentences.chinese: 交通事故致股骨頸骨折傷殘評定時機探討。

sentences.english: Media coverage of the Paralympics is rather low-key.
sentences.chinese: 媒體對傷殘奧運的報導相當低調。

sentences.english: Well, they go down the drain if you don’t have disability insurance.
sentences.chinese: 那麼，如果你沒有傷殘保險，他們付諸東流。

sentences.english: Original "Permanent Disability Certificate" issued by Grade 3A or above hospital or judiciary institutions.
sentences.chinese: 司法機關或三甲以上醫院出具的《傷殘鑑定書》原件。

sentences.english: This building was designed for the convenience of disabled people.
sentences.chinese: 這棟房子是爲方便傷殘人而設計的。

sentences.english: Finally, an example is given to show the distinction between the rate of waiver of premium and the rate of disability.
sentences.chinese: 通過實例顯示了一般傷殘率和傷殘免繳率的差異。

sentences.english: Finally, an example is given to show the distinction between the rate of waiver of premium and the rate of disability.
sentences.chinese: 通過實例顯示了一般傷殘率和傷殘免繳率的差異。

sentences.english: This sports meeting is a new milestone of disabled man's sports of our country.
sentences.chinese: 這屆運動會是我國傷殘人體育的一座新的里程碑。

definition: unable to move freely/difficult to get about
disabled/handicapped/deformity on a person or animal
to apply for (a subsidy, unemployment benefit etc)
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert a danger (esp. political or medical)
misfortune/crisis/grave danger/critical situation/disaster/emergency/to be zealous in helping others out of a predicament
